virtual std::pair< unsigned
int, Real > 		sensitivity_solve (const ParameterVector &parameters) override
 Assembles & solves the linear system(s) (dR/du)*u_p = -dR/dp, for those parameters contained within parameters. 更多...
 
virtual std::pair< unsigned
int, Real > 		weighted_sensitivity_solve (const ParameterVector &parameters, const ParameterVector &weights) override
 Assembles & solves the linear system(s) (dR/du)*u_w = sum(w_p*-dR/dp), for those parameters p contained within parameters weighted by the values w_p found within weights. 更多...
 
virtual std::pair< unsigned
int, Real > 		adjoint_solve (const QoISet &qoi_indices=QoISet()) override
 Assembles & solves the linear system (dR/du)^T*z = dq/du, for those quantities of interest q specified by qoi_indices. 更多...
 
virtual std::pair< unsigned
int, Real > 		weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solve (const ParameterVector &parameters, const ParameterVector &weights, const QoISet &qoi_indices=QoISet()) override
 Assembles & solves the linear system(s) (dR/du)^T*z_w = sum(w_p*(d^2q/dudp - d^2R/dudp*z)), for those parameters p contained within parameters, weighted by the values w_p found within weights. 更多...
 
virtual void adjoint_qoi_parameter_sensitivity (const QoISet &qoi_indices, const ParameterVector &parameters, SensitivityData &sensitivities) override
 Solves for the derivative of each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices] with respect to each parameter in parameters, placing the result for qoi i and parameter j into sensitivities[i][j]. 更多...
 
virtual void forward_qoi_parameter_sensitivity (const QoISet &qoi_indices, const ParameterVector &parameters, SensitivityData &sensitivities) override
 Solves for the derivative of each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices] with respect to each parameter in parameters, placing the result for qoi i and parameter j into sensitivities[i][j]. 更多...
 
virtual void qoi_parameter_hessian (const QoISet &qoi_indices, const ParameterVector &parameters, SensitivityData &hessian) override
 For each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices], and for a vector of parameters p, the parameter sensitivity Hessian H_ij is defined as H_ij = (d^2 q)/(d p_i d p_j) This Hessian is the output of this method, where for each q_i, H_jk is stored in hessian.second_derivative(i,j,k). 更多...
 
virtual void qoi_parameter_hessian_vector_product (const QoISet &qoi_indices, const ParameterVector &parameters, const ParameterVector &vector, SensitivityData &product) override
 For each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices], and for a vector of parameters p, the parameter sensitivity Hessian H_ij is defined as H_ij = (d^2 q)/(d p_i d p_j) The Hessian-vector product, for a vector v_k in parameter space, is S_j = H_jk v_k This product is the output of this method, where for each q_i, S_j is stored in sensitivities[i][j]. 更多...

静态 Private 属性

static const Real _default_alpha = .25
 Default Newmark alpha. 更多...
 
static const Real _default_delta = .5
 Default Newmark delta. 更多...
 
static const Real _default_timestep = 1.
 Default Newmark time step. 更多...
 

详细描述

This class contains a specific system class.

It provides an implicit time integration scheme known as the Newmark method.

In the algorithm implemented here the system is solved for displacements. Currently the Newmark scheme is implemented for constant time step sizes only. This time step is stored in the EquationSystems parameter named "Newmark \p time \p step". For the case of constant time steps the matrix only has to be assembled once, whereas the rhs has to be updated in each timestep. Default values of the Newmark parameters alpha and delta used for time integration are provided. For details refer to the examples section.

作者
Steffen Petersen
日期
2003 Implements the Newmark time integration scheme.

在文件 newmark_system.h 第 51 行定义.

在文件 newmark_system.h 第 76 行定义.

typedef Number(* libMesh::System::ValueFunctionPointer)(const Point &p, const Parameters &Parameters, const std::string &sys_name, const std::string &unknown_name)
inherited

Projects arbitrary functions onto the current solution.

The function value fptr and its gradient gptr are represented by function pointers. A gradient gptr is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives.

40  :
41  LinearImplicitSystem (es, name_in, number_in),
42  _a_0 (1./(_default_alpha*_default_timestep*_default_timestep)),
43  _a_1 (_default_delta/(_default_alpha*_default_timestep)),
44  _a_2 (1./(_default_alpha*_default_timestep)),
45  _a_3 (1./(2.*_default_alpha)-1.),
46  _a_4 (_default_delta/_default_alpha -1.),
47  _a_5 (_default_timestep/2.*(_default_delta/_default_alpha-2.)),
48  _a_6 (_default_timestep*(1.-_default_delta)),
49  _a_7 (_default_delta*_default_timestep),
50  _finished_assemble (false)
51 
52 {
53  // default values of the newmark parameters
54  es.parameters.set<Real>("Newmark alpha") = _default_alpha;
55  es.parameters.set<Real>("Newmark delta") = _default_delta;
56 
57  // time step size.
58  // should be handled at a later stage through EquationSystems?
59  es.parameters.set<Real>("Newmark time step") = _default_timestep;
60 
61  // add additional matrices and vectors that will be used in the
62  // newmark algorithm to the data structure
63  // functions LinearImplicitSystem::add_matrix and LinearImplicitSystem::add_vector
64  // are used so we do not have to bother about initialization and
65  // dof mapping
66 
67  // system matrices
68  this->add_matrix ("stiffness");
69  this->add_matrix ("damping");
70  this->add_matrix ("mass");
71 
72  // load vector
73  this->add_vector ("force");
74 
75  // the displacement and the time derivatives
76  this->add_vector ("displacement");
77  this->add_vector ("velocity");
78  this->add_vector ("acceleration");
79 
80  // contributions to the rhs
81  this->add_vector ("rhs_m");
82  this->add_vector ("rhs_c");
83 
84  // results from the previous time step
85  this->add_vector ("old_solution");
86  this->add_vector ("old_acceleration");
87 }

libMesh::System::add_matrix
SparseMatrix< Number > & add_matrix(std::string_view mat_name, ParallelType type=PARALLEL, MatrixBuildType mat_build_type=MatrixBuildType::AUTOMATIC)
Adds the additional matrix mat_name to this system.
Definition: system.C:984
SparseMatrix< Number > & libMesh::System::add_matrix ( std::string_view  mat_name,
ParallelType  type = PARALLEL,
MatrixBuildType  mat_build_type = MatrixBuildType::AUTOMATIC 
)
inherited

Adds the additional matrix mat_name to this system.

Only allowed prior to assemble(). All additional matrices have the same sparsity pattern as the matrix used during solution. When not System but the user wants to initialize the mayor matrix, then all the additional matrices, if existent, have to be initialized by the user, too.

This non-template method will add a derived matrix type corresponding to the solver package. If the user wishes to specify the matrix type to add, use the templated add_matrix method instead

参数
mat_nameA name for the matrix
typeThe serial/parallel/ghosted type of the matrix
mat_build_typeThe matrix type to build

在文件 system.C 第 984 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::_matrices, libMesh::System::_matrix_types, libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::default_solver_package(), libMesh::System::late_matrix_init() , 以及 libMesh::libmesh_assert().

参考自 libMesh::EigenSystem::add_matrices(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::add_matrices(), libMesh::EigenTimeSolver::init() , 以及 NewmarkSystem().

987 {
988  parallel_object_only();
989 
990  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(std::string(mat_name)));
991  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(int(type)));
992  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(int(mat_build_type)));
993 
994  // Return the matrix if it is already there.
995  auto it = this->_matrices.find(mat_name);
996  if (it != this->_matrices.end())
997  return *it->second;
998 
999  // Otherwise build the matrix to return.
1000  auto pr = _matrices.emplace
1001  (mat_name,
1002  SparseMatrix<Number>::build(this->comm(),
1003  libMesh::default_solver_package(),
1004  mat_build_type));
1005 
1006  _matrix_types.emplace(mat_name, type);
1007 
1008  SparseMatrix<Number> & mat = *(pr.first->second);
1009 
1010  // Initialize it first if we've already initialized the others.
1011  this->late_matrix_init(mat, type);
1012 
1013  return mat;
1014 }

使用由 solver_package 指定的线性求解器包构建一个 SparseMatrix&lt;T&gt;。

libMesh::System::late_matrix_init
void late_matrix_init(SparseMatrix< Number > &mat, ParallelType type)
Helper function to keep DofMap forward declarable in system.h.
Definition: system.C:1018
template<template< typename > class MatrixType>
SparseMatrix< Number > & libMesh::System::add_matrix ( std::string_view  mat_name,
ParallelType  type = PARALLEL 
)
inlineinherited

Adds the additional matrix mat_name to this system.

Only allowed prior to assemble(). All additional matrices have the same sparsity pattern as the matrix used during solution. When not System but the user wants to initialize the mayor matrix, then all the additional matrices, if existent, have to be initialized by the user, too.

This method will create add a derived matrix of type MatrixType<Number>. One can use the non-templated add_matrix method to add a matrix corresponding to the default solver package

参数
mat_nameA name for the matrix
typeThe serial/parallel/ghosted type of the matrix

在文件 system.h 第 2602 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::_matrices, libMesh::System::_matrix_types , 以及 libMesh::System::late_matrix_init().

2604 {
2605  // Return the matrix if it is already there.
2606  auto it = this->_matrices.find(mat_name);
2607  if (it != this->_matrices.end())
2608  return *it->second;
2609 
2610  // Otherwise build the matrix to return.
2611  auto pr = _matrices.emplace(mat_name, std::make_unique<MatrixType<Number>>(this->comm()));
2612  _matrix_types.emplace(mat_name, type);
2613 
2614  SparseMatrix<Number> & mat = *(pr.first->second);
2615 
2616  // Initialize it first if we've already initialized the others.
2617  this->late_matrix_init(mat, type);
2618 
2619  return mat;
2620 }

unsigned int libMesh::System::add_variable ( std::string_view  var,
const FEType &  type,
const std::set< subdomain_id_type > *const  active_subdomains = nullptr 
)
inherited

Adds the variable var to the list of variables for this system.

If active_subdomains is either nullptr (the default) or points to an empty set, then it will be assumed that var has no subdomain restrictions

返回
The index number for the new variable.

在文件 system.C 第 1304 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::_variable_groups, libMesh::System::_variable_numbers, libMesh::System::_variables, libMesh::Variable::active_subdomains(), libMesh::System::add_variables(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::System::identify_variable_groups(), libMesh::Variable::implicitly_active(), libMesh::System::is_initialized(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::make_range(), libMesh::System::n_variable_groups(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::System::variable(), libMesh::System::variable_name() , 以及 libMesh::System::variable_type().

参考自 libMesh::DifferentiableSystem::add_second_order_dot_vars(), libMesh::System::add_variable(), libMesh::ErrorVector::plot_error() , 以及 libMesh::System::read_header().

1307 {
1308  parallel_object_only(); // Not strictly needed, but the only safe way to keep in sync
1309 
1310  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(std::string(var)));
1311  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(type));
1312  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify((active_subdomains == nullptr)));
1313 
1314  if (active_subdomains)
1315  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(active_subdomains->size()));
1316 
1317  // Make sure the variable isn't there already
1318  // or if it is, that it's the type we want
1319  for (auto v : make_range(this->n_vars()))
1320  if (this->variable_name(v) == var)
1321  {
1322  if (this->variable_type(v) == type)
1323  {
1324  // Check whether the existing variable's active subdomains also matches
1325  // the incoming variable's active subdomains. If they don't match, then
1326  // either it is an error by the user or the user is trying to change the
1327  // subdomain restriction after the variable has already been added, which
1328  // is not supported.
1329  const Variable & existing_var = this->variable(v);
1330 
1331  // Check whether active_subdomains is not provided/empty and the existing_var is implicitly_active()
1332  bool check1 = (!active_subdomains || active_subdomains->empty()) && existing_var.implicitly_active();
1333 
1334  // Check if the provided active_subdomains is equal to the existing_var's active_subdomains
1335  bool check2 = (active_subdomains && (*active_subdomains == existing_var.active_subdomains()));
1336 
1337  // If either of these checks passed, then we already have this variable
1338  if (check1 || check2)
1339  return _variables[v].number();
1340  }
1341 
1342  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: incompatible variable " << var << " has already been added for this system!");
1343  }
1344 
1345  libmesh_assert(!this->is_initialized());
1346 
1347  if (this->n_variable_groups())
1348  {
1349  // Optimize for VariableGroups here - if the user is adding multiple
1350  // variables of the same FEType and subdomain restriction, catch
1351  // that here and add them as members of the same VariableGroup.
1352  //
1353  // start by setting this flag to whatever the user has requested
1354  // and then consider the conditions which should negate it.
1355  bool should_be_in_vg = this->identify_variable_groups();
1356 
1357  VariableGroup & vg(_variable_groups.back());
1358 
1359  // get a pointer to their subdomain restriction, if any.
1360  const std::set<subdomain_id_type> * const
1361  their_active_subdomains (vg.implicitly_active() ?
1362  nullptr : &vg.active_subdomains());
1363 
1364  // Different types?
1365  if (vg.type() != type)
1366  should_be_in_vg = false;
1367 
1368  // they are restricted, we aren't?
1369  if (their_active_subdomains &&
1370  (!active_subdomains || (active_subdomains && active_subdomains->empty())))
1371  should_be_in_vg = false;
1372 
1373  // they aren't restricted, we are?
1374  if (!their_active_subdomains && (active_subdomains && !active_subdomains->empty()))
1375  should_be_in_vg = false;
1376 
1377  if (their_active_subdomains && active_subdomains)
1378  // restricted to different sets?
1379  if (*their_active_subdomains != *active_subdomains)
1380  should_be_in_vg = false;
1381 
1382  // OK, after all that, append the variable to the vg if none of the conditions
1383  // were violated
1384  if (should_be_in_vg)
1385  {
1386  const unsigned int curr_n_vars = this->n_vars();
1387 
1388  std::string varstr(var);
1389 
1390  _variable_numbers[varstr] = curr_n_vars;
1391  vg.append (std::move(varstr));
1392  _variables.push_back(vg(vg.n_variables()-1));
1393 
1394  return curr_n_vars;
1395  }
1396  }
1397 
1398  // otherwise, fall back to adding a single variable group
1399  return this->add_variables (std::vector<std::string>(1, std::string(var)),
1400  type,
1401  active_subdomains);
1402 }

)
inherited

Adds the variable var to the list of variables for this system.

Same as before, but assumes LAGRANGE as default value for FEType.family. If active_subdomains is either nullptr (the default) or points to an empty set, then it will be assumed that var has no subdomain restrictions

libMesh::System::add_variable

const std::set< subdomain_id_type > *const  active_subdomains = nullptr 
)
inherited

Adds the variable var to the list of variables for this system.

在文件 system.C 第 1418 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::_variable_groups, libMesh::System::_variable_numbers, libMesh::System::_variables, libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::System::identify_variable_groups(), libMesh::System::is_initialized(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::make_range(), libMesh::System::n_components(), libMesh::System::n_variable_groups(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::System::variable_name() , 以及 libMesh::System::variable_type().

参考自 libMesh::System::add_variable() , 以及 libMesh::System::add_variables().

1421 {
1422  parallel_object_only(); // Not strictly needed, but the only safe way to keep in sync
1423 
1424  libmesh_assert(!this->is_initialized());
1425 
1426  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(vars.size()));
1427  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(type));
1428  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify((active_subdomains == nullptr)));
1429 
1430  if (active_subdomains)
1431  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(active_subdomains->size()));
1432 
1433  // Make sure the variable isn't there already
1434  // or if it is, that it's the type we want
1435  for (auto ovar : vars)
1436  {
1437  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(ovar));
1438 
1439  for (auto v : make_range(this->n_vars()))
1440  if (this->variable_name(v) == ovar)
1441  {
1442  if (this->variable_type(v) == type)
1443  return _variables[v].number();
1444 
1445  libmesh_error_msg("ERROR: incompatible variable " << ovar << " has already been added for this system!");
1446  }
1447  }
1448 
1449  if (this->n_variable_groups())
1450  {
1451  // Optimize for VariableGroups here - if the user is adding multiple
1452  // variables of the same FEType and subdomain restriction, catch
1453  // that here and add them as members of the same VariableGroup.
1454  //
1455  // start by setting this flag to whatever the user has requested
1456  // and then consider the conditions which should negate it.
1457  bool should_be_in_vg = this->identify_variable_groups();
1458 
1459  VariableGroup & vg(_variable_groups.back());
1460 
1461  // get a pointer to their subdomain restriction, if any.
1462  const std::set<subdomain_id_type> * const
1463  their_active_subdomains (vg.implicitly_active() ?
1464  nullptr : &vg.active_subdomains());
1465 
1466  // Different types?
1467  if (vg.type() != type)
1468  should_be_in_vg = false;
1469 
1470  // they are restricted, we aren't?
1471  if (their_active_subdomains &&
1472  (!active_subdomains || (active_subdomains && active_subdomains->empty())))
1473  should_be_in_vg = false;
1474 
1475  // they aren't restricted, we are?
1476  if (!their_active_subdomains && (active_subdomains && !active_subdomains->empty()))
1477  should_be_in_vg = false;
1478 
1479  if (their_active_subdomains && active_subdomains)
1480  // restricted to different sets?
1481  if (*their_active_subdomains != *active_subdomains)
1482  should_be_in_vg = false;
1483 
1484  // If after all that none of the conditions were violated,
1485  // append the variables to the vg and we're done
1486  if (should_be_in_vg)
1487  {
1488  unsigned int curr_n_vars = this->n_vars();
1489 
1490  for (auto ovar : vars)
1491  {
1492  curr_n_vars = this->n_vars();
1493 
1494  vg.append (ovar);
1495 
1496  _variables.push_back(vg(vg.n_variables()-1));
1497  _variable_numbers[ovar] = curr_n_vars;
1498  }
1499  return curr_n_vars;
1500  }
1501  }
1502 
1503  const unsigned int curr_n_vars = this->n_vars();
1504 
1505  const unsigned int next_first_component = this->n_components();
1506 
1507  // We weren't able to add to an existing variable group, so
1508  // add a new variable group to the list
1509  _variable_groups.push_back((active_subdomains == nullptr) ?
1510  VariableGroup(this, vars, curr_n_vars,
1511  next_first_component, type) :
1512  VariableGroup(this, vars, curr_n_vars,
1513  next_first_component, type, *active_subdomains));
1514 
1515  const VariableGroup & vg (_variable_groups.back());
1516 
1517  // Add each component of the group individually
1518  for (auto v : make_range(vars.size()))
1519  {
1520  _variables.push_back (vg(v));
1521  _variable_numbers[vars[v]] = curr_n_vars+v;
1522  }
1523 
1524  libmesh_assert_equal_to ((curr_n_vars+vars.size()), this->n_vars());
1525 
1526  // BSK - Defer this now to System::init_data() so we can detect
1527  // VariableGroups 12/28/2012
1528  // // Add the variable group to the _dof_map
1529  // _dof_map->add_variable_group (vg);
1530 
1531  // Return the number of the new variable
1532  return cast_int<unsigned int>(curr_n_vars+vars.size()-1);
1533 }

libMesh::System::add_variables
unsigned int add_variables(const std::vector< std::string > &vars, const FEType &type, const std::set< subdomain_id_type > *const active_subdomains=nullptr)
Adds the variable var to the list of variables for this system.
Definition: system.C:1418
NumericVector< Number > & libMesh::System::add_vector ( std::string_view  vec_name,
const bool  projections = true,
const ParallelType  type = PARALLEL 
)
inherited

Adds the additional vector vec_name to this system.

All the additional vectors are similarly distributed, like the solution, and initialized to zero.

By default vectors added by add_vector are projected to changed grids by reinit(). To zero them instead (more efficient), pass "false" as the second argument

If the vector already exists, the existing vector is returned. after any upgrade to the projections or type has been made. We only handle upgrades (projections false->true, or type PARALLEL->GHOSTED) in this fashion, not downgrades, on the theory that if two codes have differing needs we want to support the union of those needs, not the intersection. Downgrades can only be accomplished manually, via set_vector_preservation() or by setting a vector type() and re-initializing.

在文件 system.C 第 750 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::_dof_map, libMesh::System::_is_initialized, libMesh::System::_vector_is_adjoint, libMesh::System::_vector_projections, libMesh::System::_vectors, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::build(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::closed(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::GHOSTED, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::initialized(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::System::n_dofs(), libMesh::System::n_local_dofs(), libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::PARALLEL, libMesh::SERIAL, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::swap() , 以及 libMesh::NumericVector< T >::type().

参考自 libMesh::System::add_adjoint_rhs(), libMesh::System::add_adjoint_solution(), libMesh::System::add_sensitivity_rhs(), libMesh::System::add_sensitivity_solution(), libMesh::ExplicitSystem::add_system_rhs(), libMesh::System::add_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution(), libMesh::System::add_weighted_sensitivity_solution(), libMesh::AdjointRefinementEstimator::estimate_error(), libMesh::SecondOrderUnsteadySolver::init(), libMesh::UnsteadySolver::init(), libMesh::UnsteadySolver::init_adjoints(), libMesh::TimeSolver::init_adjoints(), libMesh::OptimizationSystem::init_data(), libMesh::ContinuationSystem::init_data(), NewmarkSystem(), libMesh::System::read_header(), libMesh::FrequencySystem::set_frequencies(), libMesh::FrequencySystem::set_frequencies_by_range() , 以及 libMesh::FrequencySystem::set_frequencies_by_steps().

753 {
754  parallel_object_only();
755 
756  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(std::string(vec_name)));
757  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(int(type)));
758  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(projections));
759 
760  // Return the vector if it is already there.
761  auto it = this->_vectors.find(vec_name);
762  if (it != this->_vectors.end())
763  {
764  // If the projection setting has *upgraded*, change it.
765  if (projections) // only do expensive lookup if needed
766  libmesh_map_find(_vector_projections, vec_name) = projections;
767 
768  NumericVector<Number> & vec = *it->second;
769 
770  // If we're in serial, our vectors are effectively SERIAL, so
771  // we'll ignore any type setting. If we're in parallel, we
772  // might have a type change to deal with.
773 
774  if (this->n_processors() > 1)
775  {
776  // If the type setting has changed in a way we can't
777  // perceive as an upgrade or a downgrade, scream.
778  libmesh_assert_equal_to(type == SERIAL,
779  vec.type() == SERIAL);
780 
781  // If the type setting has *upgraded*, change it.
782  if (type == GHOSTED && vec.type() == PARALLEL)
783  {
784  // A *really* late upgrade is expensive, but better not
785  // to risk zeroing data.
786  if (vec.initialized())
787  {
788  if (!vec.closed())
789  vec.close();
790 
791  // Ideally we'd move parallel coefficients and then
792  // add ghosted coefficients, but copy and swap is
793  // simpler. If anyone actually ever uses this case
794  // for real we can look into optimizing it.
795  auto new_vec = NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm());
796 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_GHOSTED
797  new_vec->init (this->n_dofs(), this->n_local_dofs(),
798  _dof_map->get_send_list(), /*fast=*/false,
799  GHOSTED);
800 #else
801  libmesh_error_msg("Cannot initialize ghosted vectors when they are not enabled.");
802 #endif
803 
804  *new_vec = vec;
805  vec.swap(*new_vec);
806  }
807  else
808  vec.type() = type;
809  }
810  }
811 
812  // Any upgrades are done; we're happy here.
813  return vec;
814  }
815 
816  // Otherwise build the vector
817  auto pr = _vectors.emplace(vec_name, NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm()));
818  auto buf = pr.first->second.get();
819  _vector_projections.emplace(vec_name, projections);
820  buf->type() = type;
821 
822  // Vectors are primal by default
823  _vector_is_adjoint.emplace(vec_name, -1);
824 
825  // Initialize it if necessary
826  if (_is_initialized)
827  {
828  if (type == GHOSTED)
829  {
830 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_GHOSTED
831  buf->init (this->n_dofs(), this->n_local_dofs(),
832  _dof_map->get_send_list(), /*fast=*/false,
833  GHOSTED);
834 #else
835  libmesh_error_msg("Cannot initialize ghosted vectors when they are not enabled.");
836 #endif
837  }
838  else
839  buf->init (this->n_dofs(), this->n_local_dofs(), false, type);
840  }
841 
842  return *buf;
843 }

Holds true if a vector by that name should be projected onto a changed grid, false if it should be ze...

NumericVector< Number > & libMesh::System::add_weighted_sensitivity_adjoint_solution ( unsigned int  i = 0)

A reference to one of the system's weighted sensitivity adjoint solution vectors, by default the one corresponding to the first qoi. Creates the vector if it doesn't already exist.

在文件 system.C 第 1159 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::add_vector().

参考自 libMesh::ImplicitSystem::weighted_sensitivity_solve().

1160 {
1161  return this->add_vector("weighted_sensitivity_solution");
1162 }
libMesh::System::add_vector
NumericVector< Number > & add_vector(std::string_view vec_name, const bool projections=true, const ParallelType type=PARALLEL)
Adds the additional vector vec_name to this system.
Definition: system.C:750
void libMesh::ImplicitSystem::adjoint_qoi_parameter_sensitivity ( const QoISet &  qoi_indices,
const ParameterVector &  parameters,
SensitivityData &  sensitivities 
)
overridevirtualinherited

Solves for the derivative of each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices] with respect to each parameter in parameters, placing the result for qoi i and parameter j into sensitivities[i][j].

Uses adjoint_solve() and the adjoint sensitivity method.

Currently uses finite differenced derivatives (partial q / partial p) and (partial R / partial p).

重载 libMesh::System .

在文件 implicit_system.C 第 490 行定义.

参考 std::abs(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::adjoint_solve(), libMesh::SensitivityData::allocate_data(), libMesh::ExplicitSystem::assemble_qoi(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assemble_residual_derivatives(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::dot(), libMesh::System::get_qoi_values(), libMesh::System::get_sensitivity_rhs(), libMesh::QoISet::has_index(), libMesh::System::is_adjoint_already_solved(), libMesh::System::n_qois(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::ParameterVector::size() , 以及 libMesh::TOLERANCE.

参考自 libMesh::UnsteadySolver::integrate_adjoint_sensitivity().

493 {
494  ParameterVector & parameters =
495  const_cast<ParameterVector &>(parameters_in);
496 
497  const unsigned int Np = cast_int<unsigned int>
498  (parameters.size());
499  const unsigned int Nq = this->n_qois();
500 
501  // An introduction to the problem:
502  //
503  // Residual R(u(p),p) = 0
504  // partial R / partial u = J = system matrix
505  //
506  // This implies that:
507  // d/dp(R) = 0
508  // (partial R / partial p) +
509  // (partial R / partial u) * (partial u / partial p) = 0
510 
511  // We first do an adjoint solve:
512  // J^T * z = (partial q / partial u)
513  // if we haven't already or dont have an initial condition for the adjoint
514  if (!this->is_adjoint_already_solved())
515  {
516  this->adjoint_solve(qoi_indices);
517  }
518 
519  this->assemble_residual_derivatives(parameters_in);
520 
521  // Get ready to fill in sensitivities:
522  sensitivities.allocate_data(qoi_indices, *this, parameters);
523 
524  // We use the identities:
525  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) + (partial q / partial u) *
526  // (partial u / partial p)
527  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) + (J^T * z) *
528  // (partial u / partial p)
529  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) + z * J *
530  // (partial u / partial p)
531 
532  // Leading to our final formula:
533  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) - z * (partial R / partial p)
534 
535  // In the case of adjoints with heterogenous Dirichlet boundary
536  // function phi, where
537  // q := S(u) - R(u,phi)
538  // the final formula works out to:
539  // dq/dp = (partial S / partial p) - z * (partial R / partial p)
540  // Because we currently have no direct access to
541  // (partial S / partial p), we use the identity
542  // (partial S / partial p) = (partial q / partial p) +
543  // phi * (partial R / partial p)
544  // to derive an equivalent equation:
545  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) - (z-phi) * (partial R / partial p)
546 
547  // Since z-phi degrees of freedom are zero for constrained indices,
548  // we can use the same constrained -(partial R / partial p) that we
549  // use for forward sensitivity solves, taking into account the
550  // differing sign convention.
551  //
552  // Since that vector is constrained, its constrained indices are
553  // zero, so its product with phi is zero, so we can neglect the
554  // evaluation of phi terms.
555 
556  for (unsigned int j=0; j != Np; ++j)
557  {
558  // We currently get partial derivatives via central differencing
559 
560  // (partial q / partial p) ~= (q(p+dp)-q(p-dp))/(2*dp)
561  // (partial R / partial p) ~= (rhs(p+dp) - rhs(p-dp))/(2*dp)
562 
563  Number old_parameter = *parameters[j];
564 
565  const Real delta_p =
566  TOLERANCE * std::max(std::abs(old_parameter), 1e-3);
567 
568  *parameters[j] = old_parameter - delta_p;
569  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
570  const std::vector<Number> qoi_minus = this->get_qoi_values();
571 
572  NumericVector<Number> & neg_partialR_partialp = this->get_sensitivity_rhs(j);
573 
574  *parameters[j] = old_parameter + delta_p;
575  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
576  const std::vector<Number> qoi_plus = this->get_qoi_values();
577 
578  std::vector<Number> partialq_partialp(Nq, 0);
579  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
580  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
581  partialq_partialp[i] = (qoi_plus[i] - qoi_minus[i]) / (2.*delta_p);
582 
583  // Don't leave the parameter changed
584  *parameters[j] = old_parameter;
585 
586  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
587  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
588  sensitivities[i][j] = partialq_partialp[i] +
589  neg_partialR_partialp.dot(this->get_adjoint_solution(i));
590  }
591 
592  // All parameters have been reset.
593  // Reset the original qoi.
594 
595  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
596 }

Number of currently active quantities of interest.

libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assemble_residual_derivatives

Residual parameter derivative function.
Definition: implicit_system.C:447
libMesh::Number
Real Number
Definition: libmesh_common.h:214
libMesh::System::get_qoi_values

Returns a copy of qoi, not a reference.
Definition: system.C:2301
libMesh::NumericVector< Number >
template class LIBMESH_EXPORT NumericVector< Number >
Definition: numeric_vector.C:436
std::pair< unsigned int, Real > libMesh::ImplicitSystem::adjoint_solve ( const QoISet &  qoi_indices = QoISet())
overridevirtualinherited

Assembles & solves the linear system (dR/du)^T*z = dq/du, for those quantities of interest q specified by qoi_indices.

Leave qoi_indices empty to solve all adjoint problems.

返回
A pair with the total number of linear iterations performed and the (sum of the) final residual norms

重载 libMesh::System .

被 libMesh::DifferentiableSystem 重载.

在文件 implicit_system.C 第 169 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::add_adjoint_solution(), libMesh::LinearSolver< T >::adjoint_solve(), libMesh::System::assemble_before_solve, libMesh::ExplicitSystem::assemble_qoi_derivative(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly(), libMesh::DofMap::enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly(), libMesh::System::get_adjoint_rhs(), libMesh::System::get_adjoint_solution(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::get_linear_solve_parameters(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::get_linear_solver(), libMesh::QoISet::has_index(), libMesh::make_range(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::matrix , 以及 libMesh::System::n_qois().

参考自 libMesh::ImplicitSystem::adjoint_qoi_parameter_sensitivity(), libMesh::AdjointRefinementEstimator::estimate_error(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::qoi_parameter_hessian() , 以及 libMesh::ImplicitSystem::qoi_parameter_hessian_vector_product().

170 {
171  // Log how long the linear solve takes.
172  LOG_SCOPE("adjoint_solve()", "ImplicitSystem");
173 
174  if (this->assemble_before_solve)
175  // Assemble the linear system
176  this->assembly (/* get_residual = */ false,
177  /* get_jacobian = */ true);
178 
179  // The adjoint problem is linear
180  LinearSolver<Number> * solver = this->get_linear_solver();
181 
182  // Reset and build the RHS from the QOI derivative
183  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices,
184  /* include_liftfunc = */ false,
185  /* apply_constraints = */ true);
186 
187  // Our iteration counts and residuals will be sums of the individual
188  // results
189  std::pair<unsigned int, Real> solver_params =
190  this->get_linear_solve_parameters();
191  std::pair<unsigned int, Real> totalrval = std::make_pair(0,0.0);
192 
193  for (auto i : make_range(this->n_qois()))
194  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
195  {
196  const std::pair<unsigned int, Real> rval =
197  solver->adjoint_solve (*matrix, this->add_adjoint_solution(i),
198  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i),
199  double(solver_params.second),
200  solver_params.first);
201 
202  totalrval.first += rval.first;
203  totalrval.second += rval.second;
204  }
205 
206  // The linear solver may not have fit our constraints exactly
207 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_CONSTRAINTS
208  for (auto i : make_range(this->n_qois()))
209  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
210  this->get_dof_map().enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly
211  (this->get_adjoint_solution(i), i);
212 #endif
213 
214  return totalrval;
215 }

void libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assemble_residual_derivatives ( const ParameterVector &  parameters)
overridevirtualinherited

Residual parameter derivative function.

Uses finite differences by default.

This will assemble the sensitivity rhs vectors to hold -(partial R / partial p_i), making them ready to solve the forward sensitivity equation.

Can be overridden in derived classes.

重载 libMesh::System .

在文件 implicit_system.C 第 447 行定义.

参考 std::abs(), libMesh::System::add_sensitivity_rhs(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::ExplicitSystem::rhs, libMesh::ParameterVector::size() , 以及 libMesh::TOLERANCE.

参考自 libMesh::ImplicitSystem::adjoint_qoi_parameter_sensitivity() , 以及 libMesh::ImplicitSystem::sensitivity_solve().

448 {
449  ParameterVector & parameters =
450  const_cast<ParameterVector &>(parameters_in);
451 
452  const unsigned int Np = cast_int<unsigned int>
453  (parameters.size());
454 
455  for (unsigned int p=0; p != Np; ++p)
456  {
457  NumericVector<Number> & sensitivity_rhs = this->add_sensitivity_rhs(p);
458 
459  // Approximate -(partial R / partial p) by
460  // (R(p-dp) - R(p+dp)) / (2*dp)
461 
462  Number old_parameter = *parameters[p];
463 
464  const Real delta_p =
465  TOLERANCE * std::max(std::abs(old_parameter), 1e-3);
466 
467  *parameters[p] -= delta_p;
468 
469  // this->assembly(true, false, true);
470  this->assembly(true, false, false);
471  this->rhs->close();
472  sensitivity_rhs = *this->rhs;
473 
474  *parameters[p] = old_parameter + delta_p;
475 
476  // this->assembly(true, false, true);
477  this->assembly(true, false, false);
478  this->rhs->close();
479 
480  sensitivity_rhs -= *this->rhs;
481  sensitivity_rhs /= (2*delta_p);
482  sensitivity_rhs.close();
483 
484  *parameters[p] = old_parameter;
485  }
486 }

static constexpr Real TOLERANCE

libMesh::System::_assemble_system_function

Definition: system.h:2064
void libMesh::System::attach_assemble_object ( System::Assembly &  assemble_in)

void libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::attach_shell_matrix ( ShellMatrix< Number > *  shell_matrix)
inherited

This function enables the user to provide a shell matrix, i.e.

a matrix that is not stored element-wise, but as a function. When you register your shell matrix using this function, calling solve() will no longer use the matrix member but the registered shell matrix instead. You can reset this behaviour to its original state by supplying a nullptr to this function.

在文件 linear_implicit_system.C 第 157 行定义.

参考 libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::_shell_matrix.

参考自 libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::detach_shell_matrix().

158 {
159  _shell_matrix = shell_matrix;
160 }
libMesh::LinearImplicitSystem::_shell_matrix
ShellMatrix< Number > * _shell_matrix
User supplies shell matrix or nullptr if no shell matrix is used.
Definition: linear_implicit_system.h:200
void libMesh::System::boundary_project_solution ( const std::set< boundary_id_type > &  b,
const std::vector< unsigned int > &  variables,
FunctionBase< Number > *  f,
FunctionBase< Gradient > *  g = nullptr 
)
inherited

Projects arbitrary boundary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system.

This method projects an arbitrary boundary function onto the solution via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

Only degrees of freedom which affect the function's trace on a boundary in the set b are affected. Only degrees of freedom associated with the variables listed in the vector variables are projected. The function value f and its gradient g are user-provided cloneable functors. A gradient g is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives. If non-default Parameters are to be used, they can be provided in the parameters argument.

在文件 system_projection.C 第 1244 行定义.

1248 {
1249  this->boundary_project_vector(b, variables, *solution, f, g);
1250 
1251  solution->localize(*current_local_solution);
1252 }

Projects arbitrary boundary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current syste...
Definition: system_projection.C:1280
libMesh::System::solution

Data structure to hold solution values.
Definition: system.h:1573
libMesh::System::current_local_solution
std::unique_ptr< NumericVector< Number > > current_local_solution
All the values I need to compute my contribution to the simulation at hand.
Definition: system.h:1585
void libMesh::System::boundary_project_solution ( const std::set< boundary_id_type > &  b,
const std::vector< unsigned int > &  variables,
ValueFunctionPointer  fptr,
GradientFunctionPointer  gptr,
const Parameters &  parameters 
)
inherited

Projects arbitrary boundary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system.

This method projects components of an arbitrary boundary function onto the solution via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

Only degrees of freedom which affect the function's trace on a boundary in the set b are affected. Only degrees of freedom associated with the variables listed in the vector variables are projected. The function value fptr and its gradient gptr are represented by function pointers. A gradient gptr is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives.

在文件 system_projection.C 第 1227 行定义.

1233  WrappedFunction<Number> f(*this, fptr, &parameters);
1234  WrappedFunction<Gradient> g(*this, gptr, &parameters);
1235  this->boundary_project_solution(b, variables, &f, &g);
1236 }
libMesh::System::boundary_project_solution
void boundary_project_solution(const std::set< boundary_id_type > &b, const std::vector< unsigned int > &variables, FunctionBase< Number > *f, FunctionBase< Gradient > *g=nullptr)
Projects arbitrary boundary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current syste...
Definition: system_projection.C:1244
void libMesh::System::boundary_project_vector ( const std::set< boundary_id_type > &  b,
const std::vector< unsigned int > &  variables,
NumericVector< Number > &  new_vector,
FunctionBase< Number > *  f,
FunctionBase< Gradient > *  g = nullptr,
int  is_adjoint = -1 
) const
inherited

Projects arbitrary boundary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system.

This method projects an arbitrary function via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

Only degrees of freedom which affect the function's trace on a boundary in the set b are affected. Only degrees of freedom associated with the variables listed in the vector variables are projected. The function value f and its gradient g are user-provided cloneable functors. A gradient g is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives. If non-default Parameters are to be used, they can be provided in the parameters argument.

Constrain the new vector using the requested adjoint rather than primal constraints if is_adjoint is non-negative.

在文件 system_projection.C 第 1280 行定义.

参考 libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::libmesh_ignore() , 以及 libMesh::Threads::parallel_for().

1286 {
1287  LOG_SCOPE ("boundary_project_vector()", "System");
1288 
1289  Threads::parallel_for
1290  (ConstElemRange (this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_begin(),
1291  this->get_mesh().active_local_elements_end() ),
1292  BoundaryProjectSolution(b, variables, *this, f, g,
1293  this->get_equation_systems().parameters,
1294  new_vector)
1295  );
1296 
1297  // We don't do SCALAR dofs when just projecting the boundary, so
1298  // we're done here.
1299 
1300  new_vector.close();
1301 
1302 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_CONSTRAINTS
1303  if (is_adjoint == -1)
1304  this->get_dof_map().enforce_constraints_exactly(*this, &new_vector);
1305  else if (is_adjoint >= 0)
1306  this->get_dof_map().enforce_adjoint_constraints_exactly(new_vector,
1307  is_adjoint);
1308 #else
1309  libmesh_ignore(is_adjoint);
1310 #endif
1311 }
libMesh::Threads::parallel_for
void parallel_for(const Range &range, const Body &body)
Execute the provided function object in parallel on the specified range.

void libMesh::System::boundary_project_vector ( const std::set< boundary_id_type > &  b,
const std::vector< unsigned int > &  variables,
ValueFunctionPointer  fptr,
GradientFunctionPointer  gptr,
const Parameters &  parameters,
NumericVector< Number > &  new_vector,
int  is_adjoint = -1 
) const
inherited

Projects arbitrary boundary functions onto a vector of degree of freedom values for the current system.

This method projects an arbitrary boundary function via L2 projections and nodal interpolations on each element.

Only degrees of freedom which affect the function's trace on a boundary in the set b are affected. Only degrees of freedom associated with the variables listed in the vector variables are projected. The function value fptr and its gradient gptr are represented by function pointers. A gradient gptr is only required/used for projecting onto finite element spaces with continuous derivatives.

Constrain the new vector using the requested adjoint rather than primal constraints if is_adjoint is non-negative.

在文件 system_projection.C 第 1262 行定义.

1272  this->boundary_project_vector(b, variables, new_vector, &f, &g,
1273  is_adjoint);
1274 }

Real libMesh::System::calculate_norm ( const NumericVector< Number > &  v,
unsigned int  var,
FEMNormType  norm_type,
std::set< unsigned int > *  skip_dimensions = nullptr 
) const
inherited
返回
A norm of variable var in the vector v, in the specified norm (e.g. L2, L_INF, H1)

在文件 system.C 第 1671 行定义.

参考 libMesh::DISCRETE_L1, libMesh::DISCRETE_L2, libMesh::DISCRETE_L_INF, libMesh::System::discrete_var_norm(), libMesh::L2, libMesh::System::n_vars() , 以及 libMesh::Real.

参考自 libMesh::TwostepTimeSolver::adjoint_solve(), libMesh::AdaptiveTimeSolver::calculate_norm() , 以及 libMesh::UnsteadySolver::du().

1675 {
1676  //short circuit to save time
1677  if (norm_type == DISCRETE_L1 ||
1678  norm_type == DISCRETE_L2 ||
1679  norm_type == DISCRETE_L_INF)
1680  return discrete_var_norm(v,var,norm_type);
1681 
1682  // Not a discrete norm
1683  std::vector<FEMNormType> norms(this->n_vars(), L2);
1684  std::vector<Real> weights(this->n_vars(), 0.0);
1685  norms[var] = norm_type;
1686  weights[var] = 1.0;
1687  Real val = this->calculate_norm(v, SystemNorm(norms, weights), skip_dimensions);
1688  return val;
1689 }
libMesh::DISCRETE_L2

Finds the discrete norm for the entries in the vector corresponding to Dofs associated with var...

libMesh::DISCRETE_L_INF
Definition: enum_norm_type.h:54
Real libMesh::System::calculate_norm ( const NumericVector< Number > &  v,
const SystemNorm &  norm,
std::set< unsigned int > *  skip_dimensions = nullptr 
) const
inherited
返回
A norm of the vector v, using component_norm and component_scale to choose and weight the norms of each variable.

在文件 system.C 第 1693 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::_dof_map, libMesh::System::_mesh, std::abs(), libMesh::TypeTensor< T >::add_scaled(), libMesh::FEGenericBase< T >::build(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::build(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::FEType::default_quadrature_rule(), libMesh::DISCRETE_L1, libMesh::DISCRETE_L2, libMesh::DISCRETE_L_INF, libMesh::System::discrete_var_norm(), libMesh::DofMap::dof_indices(), libMesh::MeshBase::elem_dimensions(), libMesh::Utility::enum_to_string(), libMesh::FEGenericBase< T >::get_d2phi(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::FEGenericBase< T >::get_dphi(), libMesh::FEAbstract::get_JxW(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::FEGenericBase< T >::get_phi(), libMesh::GHOSTED, libMesh::H1, libMesh::H1_SEMINORM, libMesh::H2, libMesh::H2_SEMINORM, libMesh::SystemNorm::is_discrete(), libMesh::L1, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::l1_norm(), libMesh::L2, libMesh::NumericVector< T >::l2_norm(), libMesh::L_INF, libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::linfty_norm(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::local_size(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::localize(), libMesh::make_range(), libMesh::QBase::n_points(), libMesh::System::n_vars(), libMesh::TypeTensor< T >::norm(), libMesh::TypeVector< T >::norm(), libMesh::TensorTools::norm_sq(), libMesh::TypeTensor< T >::norm_sq(), libMesh::TypeVector< T >::norm_sq(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::FEAbstract::reinit(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::size(), std::sqrt(), libMesh::SystemNorm::type(), libMesh::DofMap::variable_type(), libMesh::W1_INF_SEMINORM, libMesh::W2_INF_SEMINORM, libMesh::SystemNorm::weight() , 以及 libMesh::SystemNorm::weight_sq().

1696 {
1697  // This function must be run on all processors at once
1698  parallel_object_only();
1699 
1700  LOG_SCOPE ("calculate_norm()", "System");
1701 
1702  // Zero the norm before summation
1703  Real v_norm = 0.;
1704 
1705  if (norm.is_discrete())
1706  {
1707  //Check to see if all weights are 1.0 and all types are equal
1708  FEMNormType norm_type0 = norm.type(0);
1709  unsigned int check_var = 0, check_end = this->n_vars();
1710  for (; check_var != check_end; ++check_var)
1711  if ((norm.weight(check_var) != 1.0) || (norm.type(check_var) != norm_type0))
1712  break;
1713 
1714  //All weights were 1.0 so just do the full vector discrete norm
1715  if (check_var == this->n_vars())
1716  {
1717  if (norm_type0 == DISCRETE_L1)
1718  return v.l1_norm();
1719  if (norm_type0 == DISCRETE_L2)
1720  return v.l2_norm();
1721  if (norm_type0 == DISCRETE_L_INF)
1722  return v.linfty_norm();
1723  else
1724  libmesh_error_msg("Invalid norm_type0 = " << Utility::enum_to_string(norm_type0));
1725  }
1726 
1727  for (auto var : make_range(this->n_vars()))
1728  {
1729  // Skip any variables we don't need to integrate
1730  if (norm.weight(var) == 0.0)
1731  continue;
1732 
1733  v_norm += norm.weight(var) * discrete_var_norm(v, var, norm.type(var));
1734  }
1735 
1736  return v_norm;
1737  }
1738 
1739  // Localize the potentially parallel vector
1740  std::unique_ptr<NumericVector<Number>> local_v = NumericVector<Number>::build(this->comm());
1741  local_v->init(v.size(), v.local_size(), _dof_map->get_send_list(),
1742  true, GHOSTED);
1743  v.localize (*local_v, _dof_map->get_send_list());
1744 
1745  // I'm not sure how best to mix Hilbert norms on some variables (for
1746  // which we'll want to square then sum then square root) with norms
1747  // like L_inf (for which we'll just want to take an absolute value
1748  // and then sum).
1749  bool using_hilbert_norm = true,
1750  using_nonhilbert_norm = true;
1751 
1752  // Loop over all variables
1753  for (auto var : make_range(this->n_vars()))
1754  {
1755  // Skip any variables we don't need to integrate
1756  Real norm_weight_sq = norm.weight_sq(var);
1757  if (norm_weight_sq == 0.0)
1758  continue;
1759  Real norm_weight = norm.weight(var);
1760 
1761  // Check for unimplemented norms (rather than just returning 0).
1762  FEMNormType norm_type = norm.type(var);
1763  if ((norm_type==H1) ||
1764  (norm_type==H2) ||
1765  (norm_type==L2) ||
1766  (norm_type==H1_SEMINORM) ||
1767  (norm_type==H2_SEMINORM))
1768  {
1769  if (!using_hilbert_norm)
1770  libmesh_not_implemented();
1771  using_nonhilbert_norm = false;
1772  }
1773  else if ((norm_type==L1) ||
1774  (norm_type==L_INF) ||
1775  (norm_type==W1_INF_SEMINORM) ||
1776  (norm_type==W2_INF_SEMINORM))
1777  {
1778  if (!using_nonhilbert_norm)
1779  libmesh_not_implemented();
1780  using_hilbert_norm = false;
1781  }
1782  else
1783  libmesh_not_implemented();
1784 
1785  const FEType & fe_type = this->get_dof_map().variable_type(var);
1786 
1787  // Allow space for dims 0-3, even if we don't use them all
1788  std::vector<std::unique_ptr<FEBase>> fe_ptrs(4);
1789  std::vector<std::unique_ptr<QBase>> q_rules(4);
1790 
1791  const std::set<unsigned char> & elem_dims = _mesh.elem_dimensions();
1792 
1793  // Prepare finite elements for each dimension present in the mesh
1794  for (const auto & dim : elem_dims)
1795  {
1796  if (skip_dimensions && skip_dimensions->find(dim) != skip_dimensions->end())
1797  continue;
1798 
1799  // Construct quadrature and finite element objects
1800  q_rules[dim] = fe_type.default_quadrature_rule (dim);
1801  fe_ptrs[dim] = FEBase::build(dim, fe_type);
1802 
1803  // Attach quadrature rule to FE object
1804  fe_ptrs[dim]->attach_quadrature_rule (q_rules[dim].get());
1805  }
1806 
1807  std::vector<dof_id_type> dof_indices;
1808 
1809  // Begin the loop over the elements
1810  for (const auto & elem : this->get_mesh().active_local_element_ptr_range())
1811  {
1812  const unsigned int dim = elem->dim();
1813 
1814  // One way for implementing this would be to exchange the fe with the FEInterface- class.
1815  // However, it needs to be discussed whether integral-norms make sense for infinite elements.
1816  // or in which sense they could make sense.
1817  if (elem->infinite() )
1818  libmesh_not_implemented();
1819 
1820  if (skip_dimensions && skip_dimensions->find(dim) != skip_dimensions->end())
1821  continue;
1822 
1823  FEBase * fe = fe_ptrs[dim].get();
1824  QBase * qrule = q_rules[dim].get();
1825  libmesh_assert(fe);
1826  libmesh_assert(qrule);
1827 
1828  const std::vector<Real> & JxW = fe->get_JxW();
1829  const std::vector<std::vector<Real>> * phi = nullptr;
1830  if (norm_type == H1 ||
1831  norm_type == H2 ||
1832  norm_type == L2 ||
1833  norm_type == L1 ||
1834  norm_type == L_INF)
1835  phi = &(fe->get_phi());
1836 
1837  const std::vector<std::vector<RealGradient>> * dphi = nullptr;
1838  if (norm_type == H1 ||
1839  norm_type == H2 ||
1840  norm_type == H1_SEMINORM ||
1841  norm_type == W1_INF_SEMINORM)
1842  dphi = &(fe->get_dphi());
1843 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_SECOND_DERIVATIVES
1844  const std::vector<std::vector<RealTensor>> * d2phi = nullptr;
1845  if (norm_type == H2 ||
1846  norm_type == H2_SEMINORM ||
1847  norm_type == W2_INF_SEMINORM)
1848  d2phi = &(fe->get_d2phi());
1849 #endif
1850 
1851  fe->reinit (elem);
1852 
1853  this->get_dof_map().dof_indices (elem, dof_indices, var);
1854 
1855  const unsigned int n_qp = qrule->n_points();
1856 
1857  const unsigned int n_sf = cast_int<unsigned int>
1858  (dof_indices.size());
1859 
1860  // Begin the loop over the Quadrature points.
1861  for (unsigned int qp=0; qp<n_qp; qp++)
1862  {
1863  if (norm_type == L1)
1864  {
1865  Number u_h = 0.;
1866  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1867  u_h += (*phi)[i][qp] * (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]);
1868  v_norm += norm_weight *
1869  JxW[qp] * std::abs(u_h);
1870  }
1871 
1872  if (norm_type == L_INF)
1873  {
1874  Number u_h = 0.;
1875  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1876  u_h += (*phi)[i][qp] * (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]);
1877  v_norm = std::max(v_norm, norm_weight * std::abs(u_h));
1878  }
1879 
1880  if (norm_type == H1 ||
1881  norm_type == H2 ||
1882  norm_type == L2)
1883  {
1884  Number u_h = 0.;
1885  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1886  u_h += (*phi)[i][qp] * (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]);
1887  v_norm += norm_weight_sq *
1888  JxW[qp] * TensorTools::norm_sq(u_h);
1889  }
1890 
1891  if (norm_type == H1 ||
1892  norm_type == H2 ||
1893  norm_type == H1_SEMINORM)
1894  {
1895  Gradient grad_u_h;
1896  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1897  grad_u_h.add_scaled((*dphi)[i][qp], (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]));
1898  v_norm += norm_weight_sq *
1899  JxW[qp] * grad_u_h.norm_sq();
1900  }
1901 
1902  if (norm_type == W1_INF_SEMINORM)
1903  {
1904  Gradient grad_u_h;
1905  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1906  grad_u_h.add_scaled((*dphi)[i][qp], (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]));
1907  v_norm = std::max(v_norm, norm_weight * grad_u_h.norm());
1908  }
1909 
1910 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_SECOND_DERIVATIVES
1911  if (norm_type == H2 ||
1912  norm_type == H2_SEMINORM)
1913  {
1914  Tensor hess_u_h;
1915  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1916  hess_u_h.add_scaled((*d2phi)[i][qp], (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]));
1917  v_norm += norm_weight_sq *
1918  JxW[qp] * hess_u_h.norm_sq();
1919  }
1920 
1921  if (norm_type == W2_INF_SEMINORM)
1922  {
1923  Tensor hess_u_h;
1924  for (unsigned int i=0; i != n_sf; ++i)
1925  hess_u_h.add_scaled((*d2phi)[i][qp], (*local_v)(dof_indices[i]));
1926  v_norm = std::max(v_norm, norm_weight * hess_u_h.norm());
1927  }
1928 #endif
1929  }
1930  }
1931  }
1932 
1933  if (using_hilbert_norm)
1934  {
1935  this->comm().sum(v_norm);
1936  v_norm = std::sqrt(v_norm);
1937  }
1938  else
1939  {
1940  this->comm().max(v_norm);
1941  }
1942 
1943  return v_norm;
1944 }
libMesh::H1
Definition: enum_norm_type.h:37
libMesh::W1_INF_SEMINORM
Definition: enum_norm_type.h:49
libMesh::TypeTensor::add_scaled

在不创建临时 Tensor 的情况下将一个缩放的 Tensor 加到该 Tensor 上。
Definition: type_tensor.h:941

const FEType & variable_type(const unsigned int c) const
Definition: dof_map.h:2141
libMesh::DISCRETE_L2
Definition: enum_norm_type.h:53
libMesh::NumericVector::size

获取向量的大小。
libMesh::FEMNormType
FEMNormType
defines an enum for norms defined on vectors of finite element coefficients

Definition: enum_norm_type.h:42

Definition: tensor_tools.h:74

96 {
97  // use parent clear this will also clear the
98  // matrices and vectors added in the constructor
99  LinearImplicitSystem::clear();

102  EquationSystems & es =
103  this->get_equation_systems();

libMesh::ParallelObject::_communicator
const Parallel::Communicator & _communicator
Definition: parallel_object.h:120
bool libMesh::System::compare ( const System &  other_system,
const Real  threshold,
const bool  verbose 
) const
virtualinherited
返回
true when the other system contains identical data, up to the given threshold. Outputs some diagnostic info when verbose is set.

在文件 system.C 第 600 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::_is_initialized, libMesh::System::_sys_name, libMesh::System::_vectors, libMesh::System::get_vector(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::System::n_vectors(), libMesh::System::name(), libMesh::out , 以及 libMesh::System::solution.

603 {
604  // we do not care for matrices, but for vectors
605  libmesh_assert (_is_initialized);
606  libmesh_assert (other_system._is_initialized);
607 
608  if (verbose)
609  {
610  libMesh::out << " Systems \"" << _sys_name << "\"" << std::endl;
611  libMesh::out << " comparing matrices not supported." << std::endl;
612  libMesh::out << " comparing names...";
613  }
614 
615  // compare the name: 0 means identical
616  const int name_result = _sys_name.compare(other_system.name());
617  if (verbose)
618  {
619  if (name_result == 0)
620  libMesh::out << " identical." << std::endl;
621  else
622  libMesh::out << " names not identical." << std::endl;
623  libMesh::out << " comparing solution vector...";
624  }
625 
626 
627  // compare the solution: -1 means identical
628  const int solu_result = solution->compare (*other_system.solution.get(),
629  threshold);
630 
631  if (verbose)
632  {
633  if (solu_result == -1)
634  libMesh::out << " identical up to threshold." << std::endl;
635  else
636  libMesh::out << " first difference occurred at index = "
637  << solu_result << "." << std::endl;
638  }
639 
640 
641  // safety check, whether we handle at least the same number
642  // of vectors
643  std::vector<int> ov_result;
644 
645  if (this->n_vectors() != other_system.n_vectors())
646  {
647  if (verbose)
648  {
649  libMesh::out << " Fatal difference. This system handles "
650  << this->n_vectors() << " add'l vectors," << std::endl
651  << " while the other system handles "
652  << other_system.n_vectors()
653  << " add'l vectors." << std::endl
654  << " Aborting comparison." << std::endl;
655  }
656  return false;
657  }
658  else if (this->n_vectors() == 0)
659  {
660  // there are no additional vectors...
661  ov_result.clear ();
662  }
663  else
664  {
665  // compare other vectors
666  for (auto & [vec_name, vec] : _vectors)
667  {
668  if (verbose)
669  libMesh::out << " comparing vector \""
670  << vec_name << "\" ...";
671 
672  // assume they have the same name
673  const NumericVector<Number> & other_system_vector =
674  other_system.get_vector(vec_name);
675 
676  ov_result.push_back(vec->compare(other_system_vector, threshold));
677 
678  if (verbose)
679  {
680  if (ov_result[ov_result.size()-1] == -1)
681  libMesh::out << " identical up to threshold." << std::endl;
682  else
683  libMesh::out << " first difference occurred at" << std::endl
684  << " index = " << ov_result[ov_result.size()-1] << "." << std::endl;
685  }
686  }
687  } // finished comparing additional vectors
688 
689 
690  bool overall_result;
691 
692  // sum up the results
693  if ((name_result==0) && (solu_result==-1))
694  {
695  if (ov_result.size()==0)
696  overall_result = true;
697  else
698  {
699  bool ov_identical;
700  unsigned int n = 0;
701  do
702  {
703  ov_identical = (ov_result[n]==-1);
704  n++;
705  }
706  while (ov_identical && n<ov_result.size());
707  overall_result = ov_identical;
708  }
709  }
710  else
711  overall_result = false;
712 
713  if (verbose)
714  {
715  libMesh::out << " finished comparisons, ";
716  if (overall_result)
717  libMesh::out << "found no differences." << std::endl << std::endl;
718  else
719  libMesh::out << "found differences." << std::endl << std::endl;
720  }
721 
722  return overall_result;
723 }

162 {
163  // close the component matrices
164  this->get_matrix ("stiffness").close();
165  this->get_matrix ("mass" ).close();
166  this->get_matrix ("damping" ).close();
167 
168  // close & zero the system matrix
169  this->matrix->close (); this->matrix->zero();
170

Definition: linear_implicit_system.h:195
void libMesh::ImplicitSystem::forward_qoi_parameter_sensitivity ( const QoISet &  qoi_indices,
const ParameterVector &  parameters,
SensitivityData &  sensitivities 
)
overridevirtualinherited

Solves for the derivative of each of the system's quantities of interest q in qoi[qoi_indices] with respect to each parameter in parameters, placing the result for qoi i and parameter j into sensitivities[i][j].

Uses the forward sensitivity method.

Currently uses finite differenced derivatives (partial q / partial p) and (partial R / partial p).

重载 libMesh::System .

在文件 implicit_system.C 第 600 行定义.

参考 std::abs(), libMesh::SensitivityData::allocate_data(), libMesh::ExplicitSystem::assemble_qoi(), libMesh::ExplicitSystem::assemble_qoi_derivative(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::assembly(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::close(), libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::close(), libMesh::NumericVector< T >::dot(), libMesh::System::get_adjoint_rhs(), libMesh::System::get_qoi_values(), libMesh::System::get_sensitivity_solution(), libMesh::QoISet::has_index(), libMesh::make_range(), libMesh::ImplicitSystem::matrix, libMesh::System::n_qois(), libMesh::Real, libMesh::ExplicitSystem::rhs, libMesh::ImplicitSystem::sensitivity_solve(), libMesh::ParameterVector::size() , 以及 libMesh::TOLERANCE.

603 {
604  ParameterVector & parameters =
605  const_cast<ParameterVector &>(parameters_in);
606 
607  const unsigned int Np = cast_int<unsigned int>
608  (parameters.size());
609  const unsigned int Nq = this->n_qois();
610 
611  // An introduction to the problem:
612  //
613  // Residual R(u(p),p) = 0
614  // partial R / partial u = J = system matrix
615  //
616  // This implies that:
617  // d/dp(R) = 0
618  // (partial R / partial p) +
619  // (partial R / partial u) * (partial u / partial p) = 0
620 
621  // We first solve for (partial u / partial p) for each parameter:
622  // J * (partial u / partial p) = - (partial R / partial p)
623 
624  this->sensitivity_solve(parameters);
625 
626  // Get ready to fill in sensitivities:
627  sensitivities.allocate_data(qoi_indices, *this, parameters);
628 
629  // We use the identity:
630  // dq/dp = (partial q / partial p) + (partial q / partial u) *
631  // (partial u / partial p)
632 
633  // We get (partial q / partial u) from the user
634  this->assemble_qoi_derivative(qoi_indices,
635  /* include_liftfunc = */ true,
636  /* apply_constraints = */ false);
637 
638  // We don't need these to be closed() in this function, but libMesh
639  // standard practice is to have them closed() by the time the
640  // function exits
641  for (auto i : make_range(this->n_qois()))
642  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
643  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).close();
644 
645  for (unsigned int j=0; j != Np; ++j)
646  {
647  // We currently get partial derivatives via central differencing
648 
649  // (partial q / partial p) ~= (q(p+dp)-q(p-dp))/(2*dp)
650 
651  Number old_parameter = *parameters[j];
652 
653  const Real delta_p =
654  TOLERANCE * std::max(std::abs(old_parameter), 1e-3);
655 
656  *parameters[j] = old_parameter - delta_p;
657  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
658  const std::vector<Number> qoi_minus = this->get_qoi_values();
659 
660  *parameters[j] = old_parameter + delta_p;
661  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
662  const std::vector<Number> qoi_plus = this->get_qoi_values();
663 
664  std::vector<Number> partialq_partialp(Nq, 0);
665  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
666  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
667  partialq_partialp[i] = (qoi_plus[i] - qoi_minus[i]) / (2.*delta_p);
668 
669  // Don't leave the parameter changed
670  *parameters[j] = old_parameter;
671 
672  for (unsigned int i=0; i != Nq; ++i)
673  if (qoi_indices.has_index(i))
674  sensitivities[i][j] = partialq_partialp[i] +
675  this->get_adjoint_rhs(i).dot(this->get_sensitivity_solution(j));
676  }
677 
678  // All parameters have been reset.
679  // We didn't cache the original rhs or matrix for memory reasons,
680  // but we can restore them to a state consistent solution -
681  // principle of least surprise.
682  this->assembly(true, true);
683  this->rhs->close();
684  this->matrix->close();
685  this->assemble_qoi(qoi_indices);
686 }
libMesh::System::n_qois
unsigned int n_qois() const
Number of currently active quantities of interest.

1949 {
1950  std::ostringstream oss;
1951 
1952 
1953  const std::string & sys_name = this->name();
1954 
1955  oss << " System #" << this->number() << ", \"" << sys_name << "\"\n"
1956  << " Type \"" << this->system_type() << "\"\n"
1957  << " Variables=";
1958 
1959  for (auto vg : make_range(this->n_variable_groups()))
1960  {
1961  const VariableGroup & vg_description (this->variable_group(vg));
1962 
1963  if (vg_description.n_variables() > 1) oss << "{ ";
1964  for (auto vn : make_range(vg_description.n_variables()))
1965  oss << "\"" << vg_description.name(vn) << "\" ";
1966  if (vg_description.n_variables() > 1) oss << "} ";
1967  }
1968 
1969  oss << '\n';
1970 
1971  oss << " Finite Element Types=";
1972 #ifndef LIBMESH_ENABLE_INFINITE_ELEMENTS
1973  for (auto vg : make_range(this->n_variable_groups()))
1974  oss << "\""
1975  << Utility::enum_to_string<FEFamily>(this->get_dof_map().variable_group(vg).type().family)
1976  << "\" ";
1977 #else
1978  for (auto vg : make_range(this->n_variable_groups()))
1979  {
1980  oss << "\""
1981  << Utility::enum_to_string<FEFamily>(this->get_dof_map().variable_group(vg).type().family)
1982  << "\", \""
1983  << Utility::enum_to_string<FEFamily>(this->get_dof_map().variable_group(vg).type().radial_family)
1984  << "\" ";
1985  }
1986 
1987  oss << '\n' << " Infinite Element Mapping=";
1988  for (auto vg : make_range(this->n_variable_groups()))
1989  oss << "\""
1990  << Utility::enum_to_string<InfMapType>(this->get_dof_map().variable_group(vg).type().inf_map)
1991  << "\" ";
1992 #endif
1993 
1994  oss << '\n';
1995 
1996  oss << " Approximation Orders=";
1997  for (auto vg : make_range(this->n_variable_groups()))
1998  {
1999 #ifndef LIBMESH_ENABLE_INFINITE_ELEMENTS
2000  oss << "\""
2001  << Utility::enum_to_string<Order>(this->get_dof_map().variable_group(vg).type().order)
2002  << "\" ";
2003 #else
2004  oss << "\""
2005  << Utility::enum_to_string<Order>(this->get_dof_map().variable_group(vg).type().order)
2006  << "\", \""
2007  << Utility::enum_to_string<Order>(this->get_dof_map().variable_group(vg).type().radial_order)
2008  << "\" ";
2009 #endif
2010  }
2011 
2012  oss << '\n';
2013 
2014  oss << " n_dofs()=" << this->n_dofs() << '\n';
2015  dof_id_type local_dofs = this->n_local_dofs();
2016  oss << " n_local_dofs()=" << local_dofs << '\n';
2017  this->comm().max(local_dofs);
2018  oss << " max(n_local_dofs())=" << local_dofs << '\n';
2019 #ifdef LIBMESH_ENABLE_CONSTRAINTS
2020  oss << " n_constrained_dofs()=" << this->n_constrained_dofs() << '\n';
2021  oss << " n_local_constrained_dofs()=" << this->n_local_constrained_dofs() << '\n';
2022  dof_id_type local_unconstrained_dofs = this->n_local_dofs() - this->n_local_constrained_dofs();
2023  this->comm().max(local_unconstrained_dofs);
2024  oss << " max(local unconstrained dofs)=" << local_unconstrained_dofs << '\n';
2025 #endif
2026 
2027  oss << " " << "n_vectors()=" << this->n_vectors() << '\n';
2028  oss << " " << "n_matrices()=" << this->n_matrices() << '\n';
2029  // oss << " " << "n_additional_matrices()=" << this->n_additional_matrices() << '\n';
2030 
2031  oss << this->get_dof_map().get_info();
2032 
2033  return oss.str();

A reference to one of the system's sensitivity rhs vectors, by default the one corresponding to the first parameter. By default these vectors are built by the library, using finite differences, when assemble_residual_derivatives() is called.

bool libMesh::System::has_constraint_object ( ) const
inherited
返回
true if there is a user-defined constraint object attached to this object, false otherwise. Calling System:: get_constraint_object() when there is no user-defined constraint object attached leads to either undefined behavior (dereferencing a nullptr) or an assert (in dbg mode) so you should call this function first unless you are sure there is a user-defined constraint object attached.

void libMesh::ReferenceCounter::increment_constructor_count ( const std::string &  name)
inlineprotectednoexceptinherited

Increments the construction counter.

Should be called in the constructor of any derived class that will be reference counted.

在文件 reference_counter.h 第 183 行定义.

参考 libMesh::err, libMesh::BasicOStreamProxy< charT, traits >::get(), libMesh::Quality::name() , 以及 libMesh::Threads::spin_mtx.

参考自 libMesh::ReferenceCountedObject< RBParametrized >::ReferenceCountedObject().

184 {
185  libmesh_try
186  {
187  Threads::spin_mutex::scoped_lock lock(Threads::spin_mtx);
188  std::pair<unsigned int, unsigned int> & p = _counts[name];
189  p.first++;
190  }
191  libmesh_catch (...)
192  {
193  auto stream = libMesh::err.get();
194  stream->exceptions(stream->goodbit); // stream must not throw
195  libMesh::err << "Encountered unrecoverable error while calling "
196  << "ReferenceCounter::increment_constructor_count() "
197  << "for a(n) " << name << " object." << std::endl;
198  std::terminate();
199  }
200 }

void libMesh::System::init ( )
inherited

Initializes degrees of freedom on the current mesh.

Sets the

在文件 system.C 第 188 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::_basic_system_only, libMesh::System::init_data(), libMesh::System::is_initialized(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), libMesh::System::n_vars() , 以及 libMesh::System::user_initialization().

189 {
190  parallel_object_only();
191 
192  // Calling init() twice on the same system currently works evil
193  // magic, whether done directly or via EquationSystems::read()
194  libmesh_assert(!this->is_initialized());
195 
196  // First initialize any required data:
197  // either only the basic System data
198  if (_basic_system_only)
199  System::init_data();
200  // or all the derived class' data too
201  else
202  this->init_data();
203 
204  // If no variables have been added to this system
205  // don't do anything
206  if (!this->n_vars())
207  return;
208 
209  // Then call the user-provided initialization function
210  this->user_initialization();
211 }

在文件 system.C 第 325 行定义.

参考 libMesh::System::_matrices, libMesh::System::_matrices_initialized, libMesh::System::_matrix_types, libMesh::DofMap::attach_matrix(), libMesh::DofMap::compute_sparsity(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::SparseMatrix< T >::initialized(), libMesh::DofMap::is_attached() , 以及 libMesh::libmesh_assert().

参考自 libMesh::System::init_data() , 以及 libMesh::EigenSystem::init_matrices().

326 {
327  parallel_object_only();
328 
329  // No matrices to init
330  if (_matrices.empty())
331  {
332  // any future matrices to be added will need their own
333  // initialization
334  _matrices_initialized = true;
335 
336  return;
337  }
338 
339  // Check for quick return in case the first matrix
340  // (and by extension all the matrices) has already
341  // been initialized
342  if (_matrices.begin()->second->initialized())
343  {
344  libmesh_assert(_matrices_initialized);
345  return;
346  }
347 
348  _matrices_initialized = true;
349 
350  // Tell the matrices about the dof map, and vice versa
351  for (auto & pr : _matrices)
352  {
353  SparseMatrix<Number> & m = *(pr.second);
354  libmesh_assert (!m.initialized());
355 
356  // We want to allow repeated init() on systems, but we don't
357  // want to attach the same matrix to the DofMap twice
358  if (!this->get_dof_map().is_attached(m))
359  this->get_dof_map().attach_matrix(m);
360  }
361 
362  // Compute the sparsity pattern for the current
363  // mesh and DOF distribution. This also updates
364  // additional matrices, \p DofMap now knows them
365  this->get_dof_map().compute_sparsity(this->get_mesh());
366 
367  // Initialize matrices and set to zero
368  for (auto & pr : _matrices)
369  {
370  pr.second->init(_matrix_types[pr.first]);
371  pr.second->zero();
372  }
373 }

void libMesh::System::local_dof_indices ( const unsigned int  var,
std::set< dof_id_type > &  var_indices 
) const
inherited

Fills the std::set with the degrees of freedom on the local processor corresponding the the variable number passed in.

在文件 system.C 第 1574 行定义.

参考 libMesh::DofMap::dof_indices(), libMesh::DofMap::end_dof(), libMesh::DofMap::first_dof(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::System::get_mesh() , 以及 libMesh::libmesh_assert().

参考自 libMesh::System::discrete_var_norm().

1576 {
1577  // Make sure the set is clear
1578  var_indices.clear();
1579 
1580  std::vector<dof_id_type> dof_indices;
1581 
1582  const dof_id_type
1583  first_local = this->get_dof_map().first_dof(),
1584  end_local = this->get_dof_map().end_dof();
1585 
1586  // Begin the loop over the elements
1587  for (const auto & elem : this->get_mesh().active_local_element_ptr_range())
1588  {
1589  this->get_dof_map().dof_indices (elem, dof_indices, var);
1590 
1591  for (dof_id_type dof : dof_indices)
1592  //If the dof is owned by the local processor
1593  if (first_local <= dof && dof < end_local)
1594  var_indices.insert(dof);
1595  }
1596 
1597  // we may have missed assigning DOFs to nodes that we own
1598  // but to which we have no connected elements matching our
1599  // variable restriction criterion. this will happen, for example,
1600  // if variable V is restricted to subdomain S. We may not own
1601  // any elements which live in S, but we may own nodes which are
1602  // *connected* to elements which do.
1603  for (const auto & node : this->get_mesh().local_node_ptr_range())
1604  {
1605  libmesh_assert(node);
1606  this->get_dof_map().dof_indices (node, dof_indices, var);
1607  for (auto dof : dof_indices)
1608  if (first_local <= dof && dof < end_local)
1609  var_indices.insert(dof);
1610  }
1611 }

Gradient libMesh::System::point_gradient ( unsigned int  var,
const Point &  p,
const bool  insist_on_success = true,
const NumericVector< Number > *  sol = nullptr 
) const
inherited
返回
The gradient of the solution variable var at the physical point p in the mesh, similarly to point_value.

在文件 system.C 第 2458 行定义.

参考 libMesh::Variable::active_subdomains(), libMesh::ParallelObject::comm(), libMesh::PointLocatorBase::enable_out_of_mesh_mode(), libMesh::System::get_dof_map(), libMesh::System::get_mesh(), libMesh::MeshBase::is_serial(), libMesh::libmesh_assert(), mesh, libMesh::ParallelObject::n_processors(), libMesh::ParallelObject::processor_id(), libMesh::DofObject::processor_id(), libMesh::MeshBase::sub_point_locator() , 以及 libMesh::System::variable().

参考自 libMesh::System::point_gradient().

2462 {
2463  // This function must be called on every processor; there's no
2464  // telling where in the partition p falls.
2465  parallel_object_only();
2466 
2467  // And every processor had better agree about which point we're
2468  // looking for
2469 #ifndef NDEBUG
2470  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(p(0)));
2471 #if LIBMESH_DIM > 1
2472  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(p(1)));
2473 #endif
2474 #if LIBMESH_DIM > 2
2475  libmesh_assert(this->comm().verify(p(2)));
2476 #endif
2477 #endif // NDEBUG
2478 
2479  // Get a reference to the mesh object associated with the system object that calls this function
2480  const MeshBase & mesh = this->get_mesh();
2481 
2482  // Use an existing PointLocator or create a new one
2483  std::unique_ptr<PointLocatorBase> locator_ptr = mesh.sub_point_locator();
2484  PointLocatorBase & locator = *locator_ptr;
2485 
2486  if (!insist_on_success || !mesh.is_serial())
2487  locator.enable_out_of_mesh_mode();
2488 
2489  // Get a pointer to an element that contains p and allows us to
2490  // evaluate var
2491  const std::set<subdomain_id_type> & raw_subdomains =
2492  this->variable(var).active_subdomains();
2493  const std::set<subdomain_id_type> * implicit_subdomains =
2494  raw_subdomains.empty() ? nullptr : &raw_subdomains;
2495  const Elem * e = locator(p, implicit_subdomains);
2496 
2497  Gradient grad_u;
2498 
2499  if (e && this->get_dof_map().is_evaluable(*e, var))
2500  grad_u = point_gradient(var, p, *e, sol);
2501 
2502  // If I have an element containing p, then let's let everyone know
2503  processor_id_type lowest_owner =
2504  (e && (e->processor_id() == this->processor_id())) ?
2505  this->processor_id() : this->n_processors();
2506  this->comm().min(lowest_owner);
2507 
2508  // Everybody should get their value from a processor that was able
2509  // to compute it.
2510  // If nobody admits owning the point, we may have a problem.
2511  if (lowest_owner != this->n_processors())
2512  this->comm().broadcast(grad_u, lowest_owner);
2513  else
2514  libmesh_assert(!insist_on_success);
2515 
2516  return grad_u;
2517 }
